answer: Yes, but only if (a) the pilot had reason to make the flight anyway and (b) all participants in the flight pay their pro rata share of the flight expenses. It is not legitimate to "advertise" to fly people to destinations of their choice. That would constitute "holding out" to the public, and is disallowed by the FAA. More details can be found in AC 61-142.
